intro: Roodia, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the Malvaceae family. It is native to various regions in Africa, particularly in the eastern and southern parts of the continent. The plants are characterized by their showy, often brightly colored flowers that resemble those of the hibiscus. They typically grow in rocky or mountainous areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Roodia species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
